data.name: ability/10Desc
data.value: You can steal enemy armored cars.

data.name: ability/11Desc
data.value: You can steal enemy armored personnel cars.

data.name: ability/13Desc
data.value: If you can get close to an enemy vehicle, you are able to steal it and use it against its owners.\nThis action comes with high risk, as soldiers caught disguising as the enemy will be executed.

data.name: ability/14UnlockMessage
data.value: Well Done Soldier!\nYou can now steal and use enemy light tanks if you can manage to get close to them.

data.name: ability/13UnlockMessage
data.value: Well Done Soldier!\nYou can now steal and use enemy medium tankdestoryers if you can manage to get close to them.

data.name: ability/1UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on semi-automatic rifles by pressing space.

data.name: ability/2UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on bolt-action rifles by pressing space.

data.name: ability/3UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on assault rifles by pressing space.

data.name: ability/4UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on light machineguns by pressing space.

data.name: ability/5UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on sniper rifles by pressing space.

data.name: ability/6UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on submachineguns by pressing space.

data.name: ability/7UnlockMessage
data.value: Adjust Sights on handguns by pressing space.

data.name: ability/8UnlockMessage
data.value: You can now steal and use enemy fighterplanes if you can manage to get close to them.

data.name: ability/9Desc
data.value: You can steal enemy terrain vehicles.

data.value: The ‘75mm High-Explosive, Anti-Tank, M66, Shell’ is a High-Explosive, Anti-Tank grenade. Its shaped charge can penetrate 91mm of armor at any distance and the blast is lethal to infantry, making this an excellent dual-purpose grenade.

data.value: The ‘75mm Smoke, White Phosphorus, M64, Shell’ is an Incendiary Smoke shell. On impact it creates a large fireball that will cause damage to infantry. The following smoke can be used to blind enemy tanks, cover friendly units, or mark locations.

data.value: The ‘37mm Armor-Piercing, Capped, M51B1’ is a Armor-Piercing, Capped round. It can penetrate 66mm armor at close range and has a large normalization angle and improved damage.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/211Desc
data.value: The ‘UB-243M’ is a Armor-Piercing, Capped, High Explosive round. It can penetrate 52mm armor at close range and will do a lot of damage to the target.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/132Desc
data.value: The BZ is a 20mm Soviet armor-piercing incendiary round for the autocannon able to penetrate up to 15 mm of armor.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/133Desc
data.value: The OFZ is a Soviet high-explosive incendiary round filled with 3,8g of deadly explosives producing thousands of lethal fragments.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/30Desc
data.value: The Type D Heavy Ball is a variant of the 7.62mm rimmed cartridge designed for maximum damage. The extra power will make your gun less precise.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/5Desc
data.value: The ‘Caliber .50, Ball, M2’ is a large caliber machine gun round that is effective against personnel and light armored targets.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/217Desc
data.value: The ‘UD-354’ is an Incendiary Smoke shell. On impact it creates a large fireball that will cause damage to infantry. The following smoke can be used to blind enemy tanks, cover friendly units, or mark locations.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/134Desc
data.value: The B-32 is the standard armor piercing cartridge for the Soviet heavy machine guns. The bullet contains a steel core and a small incendiary charge.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/29Desc
data.value: The Match M72 is a .30-06 cartridge specially designed for sharpshooters. Its higher velocity provides more power at a longer range.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/216Desc
data.value: The ‘UBR-354B’ is an Armor-Piercing, Capped, High Explosive round. It can penetrate 86mm armor at close range and will do a lot of damage to the target.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/110Desc
data.value: The ‘Caliber .50, Armor Piercing, M2’ is an Armor-Piercing round. It has a hardened steel core that is capable of penetrating 20mm of armor at close range.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/26Desc
data.value: This purpose manufactured sniping ammunition features an extra carefully measured propellant charge and uses a full metal jacket projectile of match grade quality.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/28Desc
data.value: The Black Hornet is a commercial .30-06 cartridge improving upon the original M2 Ball issued by the U.S. Army. It hits harder at the cost of being slightly more imprecise.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/215Desc
data.value: The ‘USh-354’ is a Shrapnel shell. It can be set to detonate at a set distance and will also detonate on impact sending out 260 lead balls, which gives the shell a very large wounding radius.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/137Desc
data.value: The standard Red Army 7.62x38mmR ammunition for the M1895 revolver. It is cheap and reliable.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/27Desc
data.value: This rifle cartridge is designed for maximum damage. It will make your rifle very unstable but if you hit an enemy he is sure to be feeling it.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/214Desc
data.value: The ‘UBP-354’ is a High-Explosive, Anti-Tank grenade. Its shaped charge can penetrate 75mm of armor at any distance and the blast is lethal to infantry, making this an excellent dual-purpose grenade.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/24Desc
data.value: The ‘schweres Spitzgeschoß’, or ‘heavy pointed bullet’ is a lead core bullet. This bullet is designed for longer ranges.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/23Desc
data.value: The ‘Spitzgeschoß mit Eisenkern’ is is the standard ammunition for German rifles and machineguns. It has an iron core.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/70Desc
data.value: The ‘8.8cm Sprenggranatpatrone 42’ is a High-Explosive shell that is effective against soft targets. The shell contains 1kg of High Explosive.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/22Desc
data.value: This round is a steel-cored variant specially produced for submachineguns. The round achieves greater velocity and precision.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/21Desc
data.value: The tip of this projectile is made of lead to allow it to expand upon contact with soft tissue. This reduces the round's accuracy.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/69Desc
data.value: The ‘8.8cm Panzergranate 39/43’ is a Armor-Piercing, Capped, High Explosive round. It can penetrate 202mm armor at close range and will do a lot of damage to the target.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/218Desc
data.value: The ‘UBR-365K’ is an Armor-Piercing, Capped, High Explosive round. It can penetrate 126mm armor at close range and will do a lot of damage to the target.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/18Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/25Desc
data.value: The ‘2cm panzergranate 39’ is a solid steel Armor-Piercing projectile. It can penetrate up to 20mm armor at close range.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/53Desc
data.value: The Jägerpatrone Kurz is a special variant of the Kurzpatrone designed for sharpshooters. It has higher velocity and range but produces more recoil.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/176Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/180Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/160Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/162Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/161Desc

data.value: The ‘UBR-412B’ is an Armor-Piercing, Capped, High Explosive round. It can penetrate 160mm armor at close range and will do a lot of damage to the target.

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/104Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/91Desc

data.name: ammotemplate/ammotemplate/94Desc
data.value: The PZ explosive bullet, nicknamed ‘Zazhigano-Razrivnaya’, is used primarily as a spotting round but has proven highly effective against non-armored targets.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamIntro/intro_action_game
data.value: The Assault Team defines the combat roles of the players and availability of vehicles in the action game.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamIntro/intro_your_units_info
data.value: The Assault Teams under your command are marked in yellow color.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamIntro/intro_types_info
data.value: The Assault Team symbols show the different types.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamIntro/intro_resources_info
data.value: The Assault Team consists of a number of resources, like soldiers and tanks. These resources are spent during combat, either by players in the action game or by the server.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamIntro/intro_commander_info
data.value: The commander moves them across the Campaign map to initiate battles to capture towns, factories and airfields.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamIntro/intro_general_info
data.value: The Assault Team forms the backbone of the army and is the smallest formation of soldiers.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/queue_warning_description
data.value: Your assault team is currently queued for reinforcements. If you unequip the assault team, the team will be removed from the queue.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/upgrade_confirmation
data.value: Are you sure you want to upgrade this assault team? \n\nYou won't be able to equip it on your current character as the team requires more command points than your character has at the moment.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/in_battle_no_reset
data.value: You can not reset while your Assault Team is in battle

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/in_battle_no_disband
data.value: You can not disband while your Assault Team is in battle

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/in_battle_no_upgrade
data.value: You can not upgrade while your Assault Team is in battle

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/upgrade_at_warning
data.value: When upgrading your Assault Team it will be undeployed, do you confirm?

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/limited_supply_unassigned
data.value: Assault Team in processing, waiting for queue number

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/upgrade_not_enough_experience
data.value: Your team needs a higher rank

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/upgrade_not_enough_command_points
data.value: The selected officer does not have enough command points for any of the available upgrades.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/AssaultTeamOverview/limited_supply_description
data.value:
Resources are produced in batches at a fixed rate. To ensure a fair distribution of resources, only one assault team from every player will be resupplied at a time.
Assault teams further down the priority list will automatically be queued for supply when the assault team with top priority is fully resupplied. Use the arrow buttons to change the priority of your assault teams in the list.
Your queue number shows how many assault teams of the same type are waiting to be resupplied before yours.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/town_production_value
data.value: Your production value in this town:

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/town_production_desc
data.value: The gathered amount per tick depends on number of ATs in town at tick, number of deployed command points of player, underdog bonus multiplier, distance to nearest enemy capital at tick, capitals controlled by your faction and production booster multiplier.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/stockpile_tooltip
data.value: The factions stockpile will be used first.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/town_production_contested
data.value: Contested towns and skirmish battles don’t produce resources.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/DissolveAssaultTeam/deletion_failed
data.value: Error occured, please try again later

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/DissolveAssaultTeam/description
data.value: By disbanding this Assault Team, you'll lose all experience gained and customization.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseAssaultTeamSlotWindow/slot_description
data.value: A new slot will enable one more assault team under your command.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_fighter_recon
data.value: A fighter plane assault team is the smallest unit of fighter planes. It consists of a squadron of planes used for both air superiority fighting as well as ground support. They operate out of airfields and only move between airfields as they need a lot of support on the ground.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/buy_assault_team_question
data.value: Are you sure you want to buy this assault team?

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_pathfinders
data.value: Airborne assault teams are a light infantry unit that move around by airplane and are dropped into combat using parachutes. They are prized for their high mobility, but their lack of heavier equipment make them vulnerable to enemy counter-attacks. Used right, airborne troops can be very effective in capturing and securing objects of strategic importance.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_heavy_tank_destroyer
data.value: Heavy Tank Destroyers or Heavy Tank Hunter units are assault teams equipped and trained to take down heavily armored units. Though slightly less nimble than regular Tank Destroyers, they pack superior firepower to break even the thickest of armor.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_anti_tank_infantry
data.value: Anti-Tank Infantry units are infantry soldiers equipped with a number of anti-tank weapons. These includes rocket propelled grenades, recoilless rifles and both mines and grenades. While still effective as an infantry unit, they are best utilized against enemy armor.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_armor
data.value: An Armored Assault Team is a group of tanks ready to punch through weak points in the enemy's defenses. Armored units can battle it out alone, but when encountering cities they are often most effective when used together with infantry. Armored Assault Teams can be upgraded with different vehicles and various equipment for the tank crew.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_fighter_squadron
data.value: A fighter plane assault team is the smallest unit of fighter planes. It consists of a squadron of planes used for both air superiority fighting as well as ground support. They operate out of airfields and only move between airfields as they need a lot of support on the ground.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_guard
data.value: Guards are the smallest unit available. It consists of only infantrymen and is suitable in defensive positions.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_infantry
data.value: Infantry units are the backbone of all armies. The concentration of men with rifles and machineguns makes them a very versatile unit. They can dig in and defend towns and factories.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_light_armor
data.value: Light Armor assault teams are the first unit with access to tanks. They can spawn with light tanks and are mainly used to break through enemy infantry lines and fight enemy tank destroyers and motorized units.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_mechanized_infantry
data.value: Mechanized Infantry units are infantry units equipped with lightly armored half-tracks both for transport and combat. Their halftracks allows them much better cross country mobility and lets them move supplies and men into combat fast and with protection from small arms fire.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_mechanized_recon
data.value: Mechanized Recon units are using lightly armored scout cars that greatly increases their range, maneuverability and firepower

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_motorized_anti_tank_infantry
data.value: A motorized anti-tank infantry team is a unit specialized in destroying enemy armor and vehicles. Moving around in terrain-going vehicles they employ anti-tank weapons such as panzerfausts, bazookas and mines.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_motorized_guard
data.value: Guards are the smallest unit available. It consists of only infantrymen and is suitable in defensive positions. Adding a few motorcycles allows guard units to control larger areas and move faster.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_motorized_infantry
data.value: Motorized infantry uses light terrain-going vehicles to move around, greatly increasing their range and maneuverability.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_motorized_recon
data.value: Adding motorcycles to the recon assault team greatly increases its mobility and range.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_paratroopers
data.value: Airborne assault teams are a light infantry unit that move around by airplane and are dropped into combat using parachutes. They are prized for their high mobility, but their lack of heavier equipment make them vulnerable to enemy counter-attacks. Used right, airborne troops can be very effective in capturing and securing objects of strategic importance.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_recon
data.value: Recon (or Reconnaissance) infantry are very small specialized infantry units. They are equipped with scoped rifles, but are such a small unit that they are normally not effective in direct assault roles without other assault teams supporting them with manpower.

data.name: AssaultTeamScreen/PurchaseScreen/description_tank_destroyer
data.value: Tank Destroyers or Tank Hunter units are assault teams specialized in attacking enemy armored units. They are characterized with both high speed and mobility, but also the uncanny ability to hide and snipe unaware enemy tanks from afar. In a pinch they can also be used to support attacking infantry with both High Explosive rounds and their mounted machineguns.

data.name: CharacterScreen/CharacterOverview/ToolTips/combatBadgeSlotTooltip
data.value:
COMBAT BADGE SLOT
Combat Badges give the soldier certain advantages and are earned in combat through ribbons.
The soldier is able to equip one combat badge as a normal member and two as a veteran member.

data.name: CharacterScreen/CharacterOverview/ToolTips/ribbonContainerTooltip
data.value:
COMBAT RIBBONS
Combat ribbons are earned during combat by performing various actions. Points for each ribbon can be earned by multiple actions, easy actions earn few points and difficult actions earn many points.
Certain ribbon levels unlock various items, like weapons and combat badges.
Veteran members earn points faster than normal members.

data.name: CharacterScreen/CharacterOverview/ToolTips/rankButtonTooltip
data.value:
SOLDIER RANK
As the soldier engages in combat he will rise in rank. Tactical maneuvers, like capturing control-points, are more valuable than killing enemies.
The soldier is paid a salary according to his rank, the higher the rank the higher they salary. The salary is paid after each battle.
Certain ranks allow the soldier to transfer to a new branch of the army and fight using tanks or planes.

data.name: CharacterScreen/CharacterOverview/ToolTips/vehicleSlotTooltip
data.value:
%vt SLOT
You may select which specific variant of vehicle to use when this soldier joins the action game on Assault Teams with that resource available.

data.name: CharacterScreen/CharacterOverview/ToolTips/equipmentSlotTooltip
data.value:
WEAPON SLOT
The soldier's weapons are equipped in numbered slots. By default the slot numbers correspond to the key-bindings in the action game but you can re-bind them from the ingame options menu (press 'esc').
Click on a slot to equip or un-equip a weapon.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/coltm1911a1
data.value: The 1911 is a well proven, effective and hard hitting handgun. With 8 shots in the magazine, fixed sights and a solid construction, it is just the tool to help you get out of a tricky situation.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/gewehr43
data.value: The G43 is a hard-hitting semi-automatic rifle with a 10 round magazine for fast and easy reloads.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/hafthohlladungh3
data.value: The Hafthohlladung H3.5 (also known as the 'panzerknacker') is a magnetic shaped charge anti-tank grenade used by the German anti-tank soldiers. It requires a brave soldier willing to run up and place it on an enemy tank.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/kabar
data.value: The American Soldier's trusty sidekick. Good for cutting things open and poking holes in enemies. Silent and deadly, but you need to get really close to use it.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/karabiner98kurz
data.value: The standard German infantry rifle. Hard-hitting and very precise, but rather low rate of fire due to the bolt-action operation.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/karabiner98kurzscoped
data.value: By mounting a scope on the bolt-action Kar98k the rifle is converted to a very effective sniper rifle. It is a very precise weapon that holds 5 rounds in the internal magazine.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m-1910entrenchingtool
data.value: A sturdy shovel that is very useful for a wide range of jobs, from filling sandbags over digging trenches to using it as a close-combat weapon; splitting heads and bringing hurt to the enemy.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m1919browning
data.value: The M1919 is a belt-fed light machine gun used extensively by the US Armed Forces. Its high rate of fire makes it very effective at suppressing enemy troops and well placed machine gun positions can halt an entire infantry attack.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m1a1
data.value: The M1A1 is a circular steel cased U.S. anti-tank mines recognizable by its' distinctive cross shaped pressure spider.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m1a1bazooka
data.value: The M1A1 Bazooka is an Anti-Tank Rocket Launcher. It is fired from the shoulder and is a effective weapon of the US Anti-tank Teams.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m1garand
data.value: The standard weapon of the US Army. A hard-hitting effective semi-automatic rifle, that holds 8 rounds in the magazine.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m2a3
data.value: The M2A3 mine is an American anti-personnel mine. When triggered the mine launches into the air and detonates. The explosion projects a lethal spray of steel balls and fragments in all directions.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/m2hbbrowning
data.value: M2HB Heavy Machine Gun A very well-designed heavy machine gun extensively used by the US Armed Forces. Hard hitting and with a long range it is effective even against lightly armored vehicles.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/maschinengewehr42
data.value: The MG42 is the standard light machine gun of the German Army. With its high rate of fire it is feared by infantry facing it. The high rate of fire also makes it hard to control, which is why it is mainly used from the prone position.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/mauserc96
data.value: The C96 is the world's first effective semi-automatic handgun. When kept clean and well-oiled it is an effective handgun with a very good effective range.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/mkii
data.value: The Mk 2 hand grenade (also known as the pineapple grenade) is a fragmentation hand grenade issued to US armed forces. It can be thrown around 30-35 yards by an experienced soldier.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/mp40
data.value: The MP40 (or Maschinenpistole 40 as it is also known) is a fully-automatic submachinegun used by the German army. It fires a 9mm round giving it a controllable recoil and is a very effective weapon at close to medium ranges.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/no74
data.value: Commonly known as the 'sticky bomb' is a British anti-tank grenade used by the American forces. Throw it and it sticks to things, then it explodes. Often destroying the thing it is stuck to.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/panzerfaust60
data.value: The Panzerfaust 60 is a German single-use Anti-Tank weapon. It is a recoilless gun that fires a hard-hitting projectile capable of penetrating close to 200 mm of armor plating.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/schanzzeugentrenchingtool
data.value: A sturdy shovel that is very useful for a wide range of jobs, from filling sandbags over digging trenches to using it as a close-combat weapon; splitting heads and bringing hurt to the enemy.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/seitengewehr98
data.value: Also known as the bayonet/fighting knife 98k, no matter what you call it, it is an effective fighting knife as well as a tool knife. If you can get close enough to your target it is a silent and effective killer.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/smine
data.value: The S-mine is a German anti-personnel mine. When triggered the mine launches into the air and detonates. The explosion projects a lethal spray of steel balls and fragments in all directions.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/springfieldm1903
data.value: The bolt-acion M1903 is a sturdy bolt-action rifle, it loads with a 5 round stripper clip and while not super fast-firing, it is precise and hard-hitting.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/springfieldm1903scoped
data.value: By mounting a Unertl 8x scope on the bolt-action M1903 the US Army gained a precise and effective sniper rifle. It is a precise weapon that holds 5 rounds in the internal magazine.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/stenmkii
data.value: stenmkii Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec ut turpis vitae tellus vehicula pulvinar malesuada non orci. data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/stielhandgranate24
data.value: The standard German hand grenade. Twist the cap, pull the glass bead and throw. An experienced soldier can throw it 35-40 meters.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/tellermine42
data.value: The Tellermine is a large heavy Anti-Tank mine, when a vehicle drives over it and applies pressure to the mine it detonates, normally destroying the vehicle in the process.

data.name: CharacterScreen/EquipmentShop/thompsonm1a1
data.value: The Thompson M1A1 (or Tommy gun as it is sometimes known) is a fully-automatic submachine gun used by the US Armed Forces. It fires a powerful .45 caliber round and is a very effective weapon at close to medium ranges.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/salary_explanation
data.value: Amount of credits earned while actively playing

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/antiarmor
data.value: Anti Armor infantry are infantry soldiers specially trained to fight armored vehicles using rocket propelled weapons and mines.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/maximum_characters
data.value: Maximum non-general soldiers reached for this faction.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/error_input_character_name_description
data.value: You already have a soldier with this name. Please type in a unique name.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/error_input_name_too_short
data.value: The name is too short, minimum soldier name length is 3 characters.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/error_input_nothing_written
data.value: You haven't written anything, please type in a name.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/2
data.value: Once you earn your wings you are ready to fight for your country from the clear blue skies. Down enemy aircraft and support the ground forces as they advance and capture towns and factories.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/machinegunner
data.value: The Machinegunner is a central position in any army. The sheer volume of fire from machineguns can stop an entire infantry advance. So while a powerful weapon it carrying it will also put you high on the hit list of the enemy.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/4
data.value: Paratroopers are elite soldiers. Dropped into battle using parachutes, they can only carry limited amount of equipment and fight as light infantry. But the sheer surprise of enemies dropping out of the sky more than makes up for this.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/6
data.value: Men in reconnaissance units are the eyes and ears of the army and, when the need arises, the needle that pokes the enemy where it hurts them the most.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/1
data.value: The infantry is the backbone of all armies. They are the men that execute the officers' orders and armed with rifles they push forward, capturing and holding towns and strategic objectives.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/5
data.value: Where tanks are, the front is. The tankers are the men that handle these ferocious beasts on the battlefield.

data.name: CharacterScreen/PurchaseSoldierScreen/7
data.value: The General is the leader of armies. He decides what cities will become battlefields for the heroes. He fights the war using Assault Teams at his disposal. As he rises in rank, he will be able to control more units.

data.value: Please give your soldier a name:

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1aDesc
data.value: Higher Rate of Fire, More Recoil

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1aL2Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1aL5Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1aL8Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1bL2Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1bL4Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A1bL8Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2aL2Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2aL4Desc
data.value: First Batch Bullets reduces the felt recoil, but also reduces the damage

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2aL8Desc
data.value: Elite Selection bullets provides a large reduction to the felt recoil, but at a cost of damage

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2bL2Desc
data.value: Hacking the tip off bullets causes them to do a bit more damage, but at expense of a harsher recoil

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2bL4Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2bL7_9mmDesc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/A2bL7Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B1aL10Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B1aL2Desc
data.value: Fieldmodified Rifling changes the bullet speed to do a little more damage at the expense of a bit lower effective range

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B1aL5Desc
data.value: Progressive Twist Rifling changes the bullet speed to do more damage at the expense of a lower effective range

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B1bL3Desc
data.value: Recessed Crown rifling enhances the effective range at the expense of damage

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B1bL7Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B2bL2Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B2bL6Desc

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/B2bL9Desc
data.value: Minimal Freebore barrel setup greatly enhances precision at the expense of damage.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I1aDesc
data.value: Higher Rate of Fire, Less Precision

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I1aL2Desc
data.value: A Heavy Bolt will increase the rate of fire, at the expense of precision

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I1aL7Desc
data.value: An aggresively weighted bolt increases the rate of fire, at the expense of precision

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I1bDesc
data.value: Higher Precision, Lower Rate of Fire

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I1bL2Desc
data.value: A lighter Bolt increases the precision by lowering the rate of fire.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I1bL8Desc
data.value: A extra light Match Bolt increases the precision by lowering the rate of fire

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I2aDesc
data.value: Higher Rate of Fire, Less Damage

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I2aL2Desc
data.value: A slightly heavier spring will increase the rate of fire at the cost of effective damage

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I2aL8Desc
data.value: A Aggressive Heavy Spring increases the rate of fire at the the cost of effective damage

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I2bDesc
data.value: More Damage, Lower Rate of Fire

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I2bL2Desc
data.value: A lighter spring lightly increases the effective damage but reduces the rate of fire

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/I2bL7Desc
data.value: By using an upgraded power spring the rate of fire is lowered and the effective damage increases

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/aLMGA2Desc
data.value: The combination of slow burning gun powder and high quality copper used for the projectile give this bullet its high precision at minimum cost of range.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/aLMGA3Desc
data.value: Softening the tip of the projectile will produce a dangerous expanding bullet that will cause severe damage when hit. This comes at the cost of both precision and range.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/bLMGB1Desc
data.value: This barrel is made of chromium molybdenum alloy steel. This material produces a more accurate barrel at small cost of damage. The material makes it less resistant to wear and tear giving it a shorter lifespan.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/bLMGB2Desc
data.value: This special barrel uses polygonal rifling which makes the bullet spin faster producing longer range. The production method also have the benefit of creating a more durable barrel.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/iLMGI1Desc
data.value: The heavy bolt will increase rate of fire with a small penalty on precision.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/iLMGI2Desc
data.value: The heavy spring will increase rate of fire with a small penalty of increased recoil.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/T2aDesc
data.value: Higher rate of Fire, Less Range

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/aLMGA1Desc
data.value: Fastburning nitroguandine charge produces a faster rate of fire at the expense of precision and recoil. The increased bullet velocity also produces slightly increased damage.

data.name: CharacterScreen/WeaponMods/T2bDesc
data.value: More Range, Lower Rate of Fire

data.name: combatbadgetemplate/250Requirements
data.value: Participate in your first mission and reach rank 1 to receive this badge.

data.name: combatbadgetype/10Desc
data.value: Whether it's due to luck or your strong physique, injuries to your chest, arms and legs are always a bit less serious than they seemed at first.

data.name: combatbadgetype/29Desc
data.value: Knowledge of transport logistics and troop movement increases the speed of Assault Teams under the officer's command.

data.name: combatbadgetype/32Desc
data.value: Experience with engines makes you better at repairing any type of vehicle.

data.name: combatbadgetype/30Desc
data.value: Being led by a veteran commander with extensive combat experience increases the overall morale of the troops under the officer's command.

data.name: combatbadgetype/31Desc
data.value: Being able to deliver great speeches before his men will help them recover morale faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/11Desc
data.value: Keeping in shape and eating well lets you build your aerobic capacity allowing you to recover from fatigue faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/12Desc
data.value: You always seem to duck your head behind a branch when someone is looking for you.

data.name: combatbadgetype/1Desc
data.value: By emptying your pockets of unnecessary things you can fit in some extra rounds.

data.name: combatbadgetype/26Desc
data.value: Studying vehicle ignition systems enables you to steal enemy cars and motorcycles faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/27Desc
data.value: Studying armor ignition systems enables you to steal enemy tanks faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/1Effect
data.value: Start with more primary weapon ammunition

data.name: combatbadgetype/28Desc
data.value: Studying aircraft ignition systems enables you to steal enemy planes faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/2Desc
data.value: Soldiers experienced in the handling of explosives will know exactly how to trim their detonators and explosives to get the most out of them.

data.name: combatbadgetype/9Desc
data.value: You seem to always make room for one more grenade or mine (when equipped).

data.name: combatbadgetype/8Desc
data.value: Nimble-footed soldiers are much more effective at sneaking up on enemies and make much less noise when moving about.

data.name: combatbadgetype/6Effect
data.value: Increased damage against infantry- and recon vehicles

data.name: combatbadgetype/6Desc
data.value: Getting a more thorough knowledge of enemy vehicles lets you know exactly where to aim to do the most damage.

data.name: combatbadgetype/3Desc
data.value: Getting used to your weapons' sights and training regularly lets you establish a sight picture a bit faster

data.name: combatbadgetype/25Desc
data.value: After seeing action for the first time, you really know how to keep your cool and recover from fatigue slightly faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/24Effect
data.value: Automatically replenish ammo when walking over dropped weapons of the same type.

data.name: combatbadgetype/24Desc
data.value: Front soldiers experienced with missing or late ammunition resupply will often learn to scrounge up extra rounds.

data.name: combatbadgetype/23Effect
data.value: Reduced damage for soldiers in planes

data.name: combatbadgetype/23Desc
data.value: Wearing a flak jacket provides greater protection from enemy fire.

data.name: combatbadgetype/22Desc
data.value: Pilots experienced in ground attack will get bombs resupplied faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/21Desc
data.value: By disconnecting the parachute release from the jump cable you can decide for yourself when to open your parachute.

data.name: combatbadgetype/20Effect
data.value: Reduced field maintenance load for paratroopers

data.name: combatbadgetype/20Desc
data.value: Experienced paratroopers can go through their pre-jump checklists faster and get to the combat zone faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/19Effect
data.value: Reduced field maintenance load on airplanes

data.name: combatbadgetype/19Desc
data.value: Experienced pilots can go through their pre-flight checklists faster and get their plane in the air faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/18Desc
data.value: Knowing exactly how your armor's engine and electrics work allows you to get it up and running faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/17Effect
data.value: Faster reload on armor main gun

data.name: combatbadgetype/17Desc
data.value: Reloading a cannon again and again has made you into a master.

data.name: combatbadgetype/16Desc
data.value: You have a strong sense of familiarity with cars and know how to coax them into life.

data.name: combatbadgetype/15Desc
data.value: Practicing a tight grip on your weapon helps you keep your aim when firing rapidly.

data.name: combatbadgetype/14Effect
data.value: Increased damage against tanks when using anti-tank weapons

data.name: combatbadgetype/14Desc
data.value: Getting a more thorough knowledge of enemy vehicles lets you know exactly where to aim to do the most damage.

data.name: combatbadgetype/13Effect
data.value: No killcam shown when killing enemies

data.name: combatbadgetype/13Desc
data.value: By camouflaging yourself, the enemy will have a much harder time spotting the direction you attack him from.

data.name: combatbadgetype/4Desc
data.value: By practicing holding your weapon exactly the same way when you move you can limit the sway when turning around fast.

data.name: combatbadgetype/5Desc
data.value: Spending time practicing reloads will let you reload faster than other soldiers.

data.name: combatbadgetype/7Desc
data.value: Spending a lot of time practicing point shooting techniques will let you control your weapon somewhat better.

data.name: combatbadgetype/33Desc
data.value: Being able to quickly locate and treat a combat wound will enable an injured soldier to recover and get back in action faster.

data.name: combatbadgetype/34Desc
data.value: An experienced medic knows how to strip his equipment to be able to carry a few extra first aid kits.

data.name: combatbadgetype/35Desc
data.value: Working under the stressful conditions of combat teaches the medic to treat soldiers without the need for close examination.

data.name: CombatRibbonBadgeDescriptors/RibbonRank35
data.value: Golden Oak Leaves, Swords & Diamonds, 2nd Award

data.name: CombatRibbonBadgeDescriptors/RibbonRank36
data.value: Golden Oak Leaves, Swords & Diamonds, 3rd Award

data.name: CombatRibbonBadgeDescriptors/RibbonRank37
data.value: Golden Oak Leaves, Swords & Diamonds, 4th Award

data.name: commandpoint/1Desc
data.value: Command points enable the commander (Rank 12+) to deploy assault teams to fight the war.
