data.value:
Dear user of HEROES AND GENERALS

As developer and publisher of HEROES AND GENERALS, TLM PARTNERS, INC. is working continuously to improve your game experience and to ensure that our terms and policies remain transparent to you.

As part thereof, we are launching an update to our Terms of Service of HEROES AND GENERALS

The updated version of the Terms of Service replace the existing version.

You can read our new Terms of Service here.

If you have any questions, please contact our Customer Support.

data.name: ExternalText/Legal/InactiveAccountDeletion
data.value:
Dear *|GAMERTAG|*
Your account named *|GAMERTAG|* registered with this email address has not logged in to the Heroes & Generals for four years and 11 months. As part of our compliance with European legislation we will delete your account once it has been inactive for five years.

What do I do if I want to keep my account?
Launch the game and login within the next 30 days. If you don’t have the game installed currently you can go to https://heroesandgenerals.com, download the latest version and then login.

What do I do if I want my account to be deleted?
You do not have to do anything. We will not contact you again unless you contact us, and your account will automatically be deleted 30 days from today.

What does deleted mean?
When an account is deleted it is removed from all our servers. All progression and unlocks on the account will be lost. All characters, weapons, vehicles and in game currency will be lost. You will no longer be able to login to the account and the gamertag will be locked so others can’t use it.

If you need help or have questions please contact our support department at https://support.heroesandgenerals.com/

Have a nice day,
The Heroes & Generals Team

data.name: ExternalText/Legal/BattlEyeInfo
data.value:
ANTI-CHEAT TECHNOLOGIES POLICY AND CONSENT

As a further condition for using our Service, you agree to the use of anti-cheat technologies in our games as follows:

HOW IT WORKS

When players connect to our game servers, anti-cheat technologies will activate and monitor game play, the game files associated with the game, and your device’s RAM. These technologies may be downloaded to your device, and are designed to detect cheating and unauthorized third-party programs running concurrently with the game as well as any modifications to the game files enabling or facilitating cheating. When players disconnect from the game, these anti-cheat technologies will be automatically deactivated.

Unauthorized third-party programs are third-party programs or files (such as an “add ons,” “mods,” “hacks,” “trainers,” “aim bots,” “ESP,” or “cheats”) that we believe enable or facilitate cheating of any type, allow users to modify or “hack” the game interface, environment, or experience in any way not expressly authorized by us, or intercept, “mine,” or otherwise collect information from or through the game.

INFORMATION COLLECTED

If the anti-cheat technologies suspect cheating, we may collect and store relevant information that identifies you or allows us to prevent and detect the use of cheat programs. Such information may include:

  • Your account name and identifier, in-game nickname, IP address, device identifiers, hardware serial numbers, and windows user name.
  • Information about game-related and system-related files and memory such as names, data sizes, hashes, or extracts.
  • Information about processes such as name, performance information, and memory footprint.
  • Information about windows such as titles, class names, and sizes.
  • Details about any unauthorized third-party programs and the game file modifications detected and the time and date the cheating was suspected to have occurred.

OUR RIGHTS

If we determine a player has been cheating, we may also, at our discretion, terminate the targeted account, either temporarily or permanently, depending on such factors as recurrences, severity of the cheat, and impact on other players. In addition to termination of a player’s accounts, legal action may be taken against persons or entities infringing our rights. For further information regarding our rights, please review our Terms of Service.

We also collect Personal Data about you for other purposes. For further information regarding our data practices, please review our Privacy Policy.

CONSENT

You agree that you have read the information above regarding anti-cheat technologies, and you agree to the use of these technologies, which involves downloading the technologies to your device and processing information for the purposes set out above. If you withdraw your consent or remove the technologies, you understand that your account may be terminated and that you may be prohibited from accessing the game.

data.name: ExternalText/Legal/RulesAndGuidelines
data.value:
Rules and Guidelines

 

These Rules and Guidelines (hereinafter referred to as "Rules") can be seen as guidelines for the entire game universe, including forum, ingame chat, SoMe, PMs, Wiki etc. on www.heroesandgenerals.com and our official social media sites. Whenever we mention "forum" below this can be read as all of the above.
Welcome to the Official Heroes & Generals forums! These forums are here to provide you with a respectful atmosphere where you can discuss ideas, give gameplay advice, and discuss any other aspects of Heroes & Generals with other players.


Community forums are at their best when participants treat their fellow posters with respect and courtesy. Therefore, we ask that you conduct yourself in a civilized manner when participating on these forums.


The Rules listed below explain what behavior is expected of you and what behavior you can expect from other community members. The Rules are not exhaustive, and may not address all manner of offensive behavior. As such, the official Heroes & Generals forum moderators and administrators shall have full discretion to address any behavior that they feel is inappropriate.
Also, suspension or banishment from the game will always result in the same in regard to forum access. Your access to these forums is a "privilege" and not a “right.” TLM Partners Inc. reserves the right to delete, update or modify any information, which is considered inappropriate on these forums.


TLM Partners Inc. also reserves the right to suspend your access to these forums at any time for reasons that include, but are not necessarily limited to, your failure to abide by these Rules. TLM Partners Inc. reserves the right to evaluate each incident on a case by case basis.


Before posting any kind of information on this forum, all users are to read the following Rules. These Rules are obligatory for all registered users on this forum.

 

§1 ETIQUETTE

Users are to treat others with respect. This applies to both public threads, chat and private messages (PMs).
Disrespect can include:

  • Flaming
  • Trolling
  • Harassment or defamatory remarks
  • Abusive or personal attacks
  • Profanity, swearing, inappropriate language or abbreviations thereof
  • Racial, religious, sexual, national or ethnic, slurs or insults (this includes "jokes" in bad taste)
  • Excessive Capitalization
  • Publicly accusing players of rule breaking (users should contact our support team instead)

 

§2 DISTRIBUTION OF REAL LIFE INFORMATION

Postings and discussions which have users’ personal data – regardless of whether this is their own or that of other users – are not allowed and will be removed.
Personal data includes:

  • Addresses
  • Telephone numbers
  • E-mails
  • Instant messaging services IDs
  • Credit card details
  • Account details or password
  • Images or pictures, where a person is easily identifiable
  • Other contact information

Use of own real-life name is strongly discouraged. Postings and discussions, which include real-life names of others, are not allowed.
No release of real-life information about official moderators or TLM Partners Inc. employees is allowed on these forums.

 

§3 REAL-LIFE THREATS

Real-life threats are not tolerated on the forums.
This includes both express and masked language and/or links to websites containing such language or images which refers to violence in any capacity that is not directly related to the game world.
Real-life threats will be handed over to the police for possible prosecution.

 

§4 ADVERTISING

Users are not allowed to post threads or comments to any of the forums that advertise or solicit any non-beneficial, non-Heroes & Generals related businesses, organizations, or websites.

Explicit advertising and solicitation in signatures are also prohibited.
Users are allowed to discuss other war games; however, be aware that any kind of solicitation of or linking to other games is not permitted.

 

§5 ACCOUNTS

All types of posts for the sale or promotion of the exchange or transfer of accounts, currency, codes, and other services from one user to another are prohibited within the forums and game channels.

 

§6 OFF TOPIC, SPAMMING AND TROLLING

All users will get a better forum experience if they refrain from:

  • Excessively communicating the same phrase, similar phrases, or pure gibberish.
  • Offtopic posting.
  • Creating threads/posts for the sole purpose of causing unrest on the forums.
  • Creating threads/posts for purpose of reporting or discussing in game violations. Such incidences are to be directed to our support team.
  • Causing disturbances in forum threads, such as picking fights, making off topic posts that ruin the thread, insulting other posters.
  • Making non-constructive posts, or posts with non-constructive topics.
  • Posting excessively in capital letters, excessive whitespace or line breaks, leet speak, or other hard-to- read writing styles.
  • Using misleading topic titles, excessive punctuation, and/or non-standard symbols.
  • Abusing font size and color to creative disruptive posts.
  • Abusing the "Reported Post" feature by sending false alarms or nonsensical messages.
  • Numbering a thread, posting "First!", "IBTL" ("in before thread lock") or any other fad statements.
  • "Bumping" posts. Some sections may allow "bumping" in moderation, but users are to check the subsection of the forum to make sure that it is allowed in that section.
  • Petition posts or polls that are not aimed at conducting a discussion. Bumping IS allowed once a month in the recruitment section.
  • Begging the support team or fellow players for free things.
  • Armchair lawyering, discussing legal interpretations/validity of Terms of Service, Privacy Policy, Rules, support team decisions etc. with the purpose of trolling or starting flamewars.
  • Discussing real-world politics and pursuing ideological debate.
  • Adding "+1" posts to show agreement with the previous poster. Please use the post-reputation system instead.

 

Users are asked to familiarize themselves with the forums to make sure that they post new threads and postings in the appropriate forum. This helps other users and moderators maintain an overview and to be able to respond faster with appropriate answers to questions.
Before beginning a new thread, users should look to see if an active thread on that topic has already been established using the search feature. If so, users are asked to place their comments there instead. Keep discussions about one topic to one thread only. Posts which drift off topic, or content-free posts, will be edited or removed. Posting multiple messages with the same content across several forums is unwelcome and inappropriate, since such activities divide the targeted discussions and makes gathering feedback considerably more difficult. Such ‘cross posts’ will be merged, closed and redirected or removed.

 

§7 LAW VIOLATIONS

Users are expected to act lawfully when participating on the forums. Posting about or discussing issues that violate local or international laws is not allowed under any circumstance. This includes:

  • Posting discussion threads on, or linking to, cheats, hacks, trojan horses, malicious programs or swatting. If users suspect that a cheat or hack exists, provide the necessary information to our support team. This is not to be discussed within the forums.
  • Posting unreleased content / hacking data files; showing unreleased in-game items, equipment, or areas that have been unlocked by hacking into client data files; discussing or displaying any data not available through normal game play.
  • Posting about illegal drugs or activities. Both express and masked language and/or links to websites containing such language or images which reference to abusing illegal drugs or to performing illegal activities are prohibited.

 

Severe cases will be handed over to the police for possible prosecution.

 

§8 DISCUSSING DISCIPLINARY ACTIONS

Disciplinary actions are a private matter between TLM Partners Inc. and the individual user.

  • Creating posts or threads to discuss disciplinary actions taken against a player in game or on the forums is not allowed.
  • Posts or threads created to discuss moderators or moderator decisions and actions will be deleted.

 

§9 LANGUAGE

The official language of this forum is English. Transliteration and intentionally distorted or illiterate language is unwelcome.
Please be aware that not all users are native English speakers. Be considerate to those who obviously have difficulties with English – they still have interesting things to say.
Posting in non-English is restricted to the Clan/Army & Non-English section only.

 

§10 LINKS AND IMAGES

Users are required to make sure that they do not violate any of the Rules, whenever linking to a website or image, choosing an image for an avatar or signature or posting an image.
Sites or images that display illegal content, pornography, nudity, gratuitous violence, Nazi symbols such as swastikas, obscenities and any other content that goes against the standards of this community will be removed.
In addition to the above, we also request users not post ASCII art as they are pure eye-torture when viewing the forum on a mobile phone.
Images used in player signatures must be of a reasonable size, and users are asked not to use flashing images and other material that may cause irritation or distraction for other users in their signatures/avatars. While GIF images are fine, quickly flashing, bright colored images can cause headaches or worse for people who are prone to seizures.

 

§11 PLAYER, CHARACTER, WEAPON AND ASSAULT TEAM NAMES

Whenever users are given the opportunity to name something in the game, users must follow the rules here as well as common decency. If TLM Partners Inc. finds names to be offensive or improper, TLM Partners Inc. may, at their sole and absolute discretion, delete or change these names and/or suspend or ban (terminate) any account.
The following types of names are unacceptable for use:

  • Names that belong to other persons with the intent to impersonate that person, including without limitation admins/game masters/moderators, employees, or agents of TLM Partners Inc.;
  • Profane, racist, defamatory, obscene or rude names including swear words (all languages), obscene anatomical references, racial slurs as well as their
    homonyms;
  • Names of people or organizations directly involved in crimes against humanity such as, but not limited to Waffen SS;
  • Information subject to the rights of any other person or entity without written authorization from that person or entity;
  • Names that belong to a popular culture figure, celebrity, or media personality;
  • Names that contain or is substantially similar to trademarked names from other products or services, whether registered or not;
  • Names that are hateful towards or promoting religious figures or deities;
  • Names related to drugs, sex, alcohol, or criminal activity;
  • Names that are comprised mainly of unpronounceable characters, e.g., "'-_-_===" is not ok, while "_-UnderscoreMan- _" is;

 

and any names that within common sense violates the Rules. For instance, if someone has been tried and convicted for crimes against humanity they are probably not a good role-model.

Users may not use misspellings, leet-speek/dudespeak or alternative spellings to circumvent the name restrictions listed above, nor can users have a "first" and "last" name that, when combined, violate the above name restrictions.

 

§12 SANCTIONS

If a thread or post is in violation of the forum rules, users are encouraged to use the report button on the post and provide information as to why the thread or post is in violation.
If a user or user account is found to be in violation of the Rules, the user may:

  • Be given a warning by TLM Partners Inc.; or
  • Be given a temporary or permanent account suspension (ban) from forums, the game, other platforms or all depending upon the severity of the violation.

 

Updated: 2018-05-25

data.value: Credits can be used to acquire new weapons and upgrades for existing weapons.

data.name: FirstBlood/awards_description_salary
data.value: When solders go to war they earn credits. The amount of credits earned is based on performance and rank.

data.name: FirstBlood/awards_description_ribbons_extra

data.name: FirstBlood/awards_description_ribbons

data.name: FirstBlood/awards_description_badge_extra

data.name: FirstBlood/awards_description_badge
data.value: Combinations of different Combat Ribbons will unlock combat Badges.

data.name: FirstBlood/faction_overpop_warning
data.value: Note: This faction has many players, which may cause longer matchmaking times.

data.name: FirstBlood/loading_message_bots
data.value: While you're learning the ropes, you will be fighting against <highlight>bots</highlight> alongside other recruits for the first few battles. Once you reach <highlight>Player Level 2</highlight>, you will start facing tougher resistance from real players.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/1
data.value: While in a vehicle, you can change seat by pressing C.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/10
data.value: Press E to pick up weapons from fallen soldiers.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/11
data.value: For the best experience, press Escape, choose "Video Settings" and adjust the settings to fit your machine.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/12
data.value: Press ESC and choose "Input Settings" to personalize controls

data.name: HintOfTheDay/13
data.value: Press F7 to toggle FPS/Ping display in the top-right corner

data.name: HintOfTheDay/16
data.value: Use the map to find supply crates. Hold M to see the map.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/14
data.value: Once your first soldier reaches rank 3, you can join advanced maps.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/15
data.value: Hold down E on supply-creates to resupply health and ammo.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/2
data.value: All control points have a radio. Stand near the radio to capture the point.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/17
data.value: Hold CTRL to crouch or push Z to go into prone mode flat on the ground.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/18
data.value: Hold SHIFT to sprint, but keep an eye on your fatigue bar in the lower left corner.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/3
data.value: Hold TAB to see the scoreboard.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/4
data.value: Your team mates as well as all control points are shown on the map. Hold M to see the map.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/19
data.value: You can sprint longer distances if you carry a light load.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/5
data.value: Push T to talk to members of your team.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/20
data.value: Keep an ear out to hear what entrance enemies are entering your building from.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/21
data.value: Hold the ALT key to walk slower and more silently.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/6
data.value: Regular infantry can bring anti-tank mines and sticky/magnetic bombs if faced with armor on the battlefield.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/7
data.value: Press F2 to toggle the tactical overlay showing control points on/off.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/22
data.value: Press R to reload your weapon at will.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/23
data.value: Hold right mouse button to aim in precision mode.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/8
data.value: Sniper scopes appear blurry when sight is more than 100m off.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/24
data.value: Press F to whistle. Drivers might let you on if they are notified of your presence.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/9
data.value: Hold M to see the map.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/25
data.value: Honk the horn with left mouse button when you're the driver of a transportation vehicle.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/26
data.value: Together you stand a better chance and driving is faster than running. Try to pick up soldiers when you drive any vehicle.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/27
data.value: Mechanized assault teams have access to half track vehicles that work as mobile spawn points.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/28
data.value: Keep an eye on your spawn menu to see whether there is a mobile spawn point close to your target.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/29
data.value: Members of your squad are shown as yellow triangles on the map.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/30
data.value: Press B to switch to the binoculars and hold the right mouse button to use them.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/32
data.value: Toggle between ammo types in tanks (HE/AP) by using the mouse wheel or pressing 1 or 2 on the keyboard.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/33
data.value: Press Q to toggle between main gun and secondary gun in some tanks.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/34
data.value: Right-click when the map is open to zoom.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/35
data.value: You can press F12 to undeploy if you get stuck.

data.name: HintOfTheDay/31
data.value: Squad leaders can use their binoculars to issue orders.

data.name: InfoWindows/ssPhase2Title
data.value: Gold is no longer available for purchase

data.name: InfoWindows/ssPhase2Description
data.value:
After 15 years of development and 8 years of deployment “Heroes and Generals: World War II” will be shutting down. Because of this, players no longer have the ability to purchase gold.

TLM Games will be shutting down all servers on 05/25/2023. We thank you for playing our game and being part of our community. It's been a pleasure serving you all.

As we begin the process of sunsetting the game, the current team will be simultaneously honing their skills in UE5 - working towards a completely new game and playable prototype (MVP) of Heroes & Generals 2: The Next War.

data.name: InfoWindows/ssPhase3Description
data.value: GOLD RUSH: You have unlimited gold until H&G shuts down. TLM Games will be shutting down all servers on 05/25/2023. We thank you for playing our game and being part of our community. It's been a pleasure serving you all.

data.name: InfoWindows/ksPopupDescription
data.value:
First off we are excited to announce that we have been selected by Kickstarter as a “Project We Love!”

Now…we ask you to help make Heroes and Generals 2 a reality and make a pledge today!

To learn more about HnG 2 and our Kickstarter, click the link below and we look forward to seeing you on the battlefield!

data.name: LaunchCommand/lock_warning_2
data.value: Are you sure you want to give up the spawn slot ?

data.name: LaunchCommand/lock_warning_1
data.value: Your soldier is locked to this battle until it is over.

data.name: LaunchCommand/no_game_server_1
data.value: We are sorry! There are no available game servers at the moment.

data.name: LaunchCommand/run_warning_2
data.value: Do you want to join this server ?

data.name: LaunchCommand/ping_warning_1
data.value: Your ping time to the server hosting this battle is

data.name: LaunchCommand/ping_warning_3
data.value: Are you sure you want to join this server ?

data.name: LaunchCommand/ping_warning_4
data.value: If possible choose a battle with green or yellow indicator

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA001Desc
data.value: Experienced pilots can go through their pre-flight checklists faster and get their plane in the air faster.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA002Desc
data.value: Automatically deploy parachute so you are not killed when hitting the ground (might still take some damage from fall)

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA002Effect
data.value: Parachute deploys when close to ground

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA003Desc
data.value: By disconnecting the parachute release from the jump cable you can decide for yourself when to open your parachute.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA004Desc
data.value: Pilots experienced in ground attack will get an extra bomb mounted on their plane.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA004Effect
data.value: Carry an extra bomb on airplane

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA005Desc
data.value: Wearing a flak jacket reduces the risk of the pilot getting hurt by bullets fired from the ground.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CA005Effect
data.value: Reduce damage taken from ground fire

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI001Desc
data.value: Front soldiers experienced with missing or late ammunition resupply will often learn to scrounge up extra rounds.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI001Effect
data.value: Replenish ammo when walking over dead enemies

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI002Desc
data.value: By emptying your pockets of unnecessary things you can fit in some extra rounds.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI002Effect
data.value: Start with more primary weapon ammunition

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI003Desc
data.value: Soldiers experienced in the handling of explosives will know exactly how to trim their detonators and explosives to get the most out of them.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI004Desc
data.value: Getting used to your weapons' sights and training regularly lets you establish a sight picture a bit faster

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI005Desc
data.value: By practicing holding your weapon exactly the same way when you move you can limit the sway when turning around fast.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI006Desc
data.value: Spending time practicing reloads will let you reload faster than other soldiers

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI007Desc
data.value: Getting a more thorough knowledge of enemy vehicles lets you know exactly where to aim to do the most damage.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI008Desc
data.value: Spending a lot of time practicing firing from the hip will let you control your weapon somewhat better.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI009Desc
data.value: Nimble footed soldiers are much more effective at sneaking up on enemies and makes much less noise when moving about

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI010Desc
data.value: You seem to always make room for one more grenade or mine (when equipped).

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI011Desc
data.value: In a way you are lucky. Whenever you get hurt, it's always a bit less serious than it seemed at first.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI012Desc
data.value: Keeping in shape and eating well lets you build more stamina allowing you to sprint for a longer time

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI013Desc
data.value: You always seem to duck your head behind a branch when someone is looking for you.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI014Desc
data.value: By camouflaging yourself, the enemy will have a much harder time spotting the direction you attack him from.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI014Effect
data.value: No killcam shown when killing enemies

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI015Desc
data.value: Spending time studying enemy armored vehicles can come in handy. You have gained a knack for hitting enemy armor where it hurts.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI017Desc
data.value: After seeing action for the first time, you really know how important it is to get out of the way of enemy bullets.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CI016Desc
data.value: Practicing a tight grip on your weapon helps you keep your aim when firing rapidly.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CV001Desc
data.value: You have a strong sense of familiarity with cars and know how to coax them into life.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CV002Desc
data.value: Reloading a cannon again and again has made you into a master.

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CV002Effect
data.value: Faster reload on armor main gun

data.name: old_CombatBadges/CV003Desc
data.value: Knowing exactly how your armor's engine and electrics work allows you to get it up and running faster.

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC001Desc
data.value: Destroying 5 pieces of enemy Armor as Infantry in a battle

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC002Desc
data.value: Destroying 5 pieces of enemy Armor from armored unit in a battle

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC003Desc
data.value: Destroying 5 pieces of enemy armor from airplane in a battle

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC004Desc
data.value: Destroying 10 enemy infantrymen in a battle as Infantry

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC006Desc
data.value: Destroying 10 enemy Infantrymen in a battle from an airplane

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC007Req
data.value: Destroy %D enemy held structures in a battle

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC008Desc
data.value: Get five savior kills in a battle

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC008Req
data.value: Get %D sets of 5 saviour kills in a battle

data.name: old_CombatRibbons/RC009Desc

data.name: ribbon/1000Desc
data.value: Maneuvering tanks in battle requires skill and training.\nThe more you drive tanks of any kind, the more points you earn for this ribbon.

data.name: ribbon/112Desc
data.value: Using medic kits to treat combat injuries in the heat of battle will earn you points on this ribbon. More points are earned by helping friendly soldiers.

data.name: ribbon/1001Desc
data.value: Scoring successful hits against enemy armor using the main cannon of your tanks will earn you points on this ribbon.

data.name: ribbon/1002Desc
data.value: Using a tank in battle against enemy armor will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for scoring hits on enemy tanks. The highest award is given for destroying enemy tanks.

data.name: ribbon/100Desc
data.value: Moving fast from tactical positions during combat is crucial for winning battles.\nDriving military as well as civilian vehicles will earn you points on this ribbon.

data.name: ribbon/79Desc
data.value: Using any full-auto, semi-auto or bolt-action rifle in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/109Desc
data.value: Using the Curtiss P-40N Warhawk fighter aircraft in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nPoints are scored for damaging or killing enemy aircraft as well as ground units.

data.name: ribbon/101Desc
data.value: Getting soldiers quickly from one tactical position to another during combat is vital for ensuring victory.\nTransporting friendly soldiers using military and civilian vehicles will earn you points on this ribbon.

data.name: ribbon/105Desc
data.value: Using the QMC-4 1/4 Ton Amphibian amphibious vehicle in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nPoints are awarded for transporting soldiers into battle.

data.name: ribbon/102Desc
data.value: Using the Type 166 Schwimmwagen amphibious vehicle in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nPoints are awarded for transporting soldiers into battle.

data.name: ribbon/10Desc
data.value: Using the SdKfz 2 Kettenkrad in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nExtra points are awarded for transporting soldiers into battle.

data.name: ribbon/11Desc
data.value: Using any light machinegun in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/12Desc
data.value: Learning to defend yourself when you are out of ammunition can save your life.\n Points for this ribbon are scored by hurting or killing enemy soldiers using your combat knife or even your spade.

data.name: ribbon/13Desc
data.value: Using the sub-machinegun in combat will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/14Desc
data.value: Using the handguns in combat will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/110Desc
data.value: Using the Petlyakov Pe-3bis fighter aircraft in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nPoints are scored for damaging or killing enemy aircraft as well as ground units.

data.name: ribbon/15Desc
data.value: Using the M1A1 Carbine in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/111Desc
data.value: Using the Messerschmitt Me 410 B-2 fighter aircraft in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nPoints are scored for damaging or killing enemy aircraft as well as ground units.

data.name: ribbon/16Desc
data.value: Using the PPS-43 submachine gun in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/17Desc
data.value: Using the BA-6 reconnaissance vehicle in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for using the vehicles armament to destroy enemy soldiers and vehicles.

data.name: ribbon/1Desc
data.value: Physical fitness is the basic skill for any soldier.\nPoints for this ribbon are earned by running, sprinting and riding bicycles.

data.name: ribbon/2000Desc
data.value: Combat Aviation is one of the finest disciplines of war with the battle between two skilled pilots.\nPoints are earned for this ribbon for skilled use of aircraft armaments against enemy planes.

data.name: ribbon/91Desc
data.value: Using the P38 Parabellum pistol in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/2001Desc
data.value: It requires great skill dropping a single bomb precisely on a ground target.\nPoints for this ribbon are earned by bombing enemy vehicles and soldiers.

data.name: ribbon/2002Desc
data.value: The support of a fighter aircraft is greatly appreciated by ground forces.\nPoints for this ribbon are earned by killing ground enemies using the aircraft machineguns and cannons.

data.name: ribbon/2Desc
data.value: Knowing how to move in combat when fully geared up is vital for any soldier's survival.\nEarn points for this ribbon by walking carefully or moving in a crouched position.

data.name: ribbon/9Desc
data.value: Using the C96 pistol in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/4Desc
data.value: Defending your ground is just as important as gaining new.\nEarn points for this ribbon by killing enemies trying to capture your control points and winning battles as defender.

data.name: ribbon/8Desc
data.value: Using the M1917 revolver in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/135Desc
data.value: Using the M36B1 Tank Destroyer in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for scoring hits on enemy tanks. The highest award is given for destroying enemy tanks.

data.name: ribbon/50Desc
data.value: Grenades and mines pose a very serious threat to your enemies.\nUse handgrenades to hurt or kill enemies to earn points for this ribbon.

data.name: ribbon/18Desc
data.value: Using the P08 Parabellum pistol in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/22Desc
data.value: Using the M3 Greasegun submachinegun in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/51Desc
data.value: Destroying tanks with your bare hands is a very dangerous business.\nPoints for this ribbon are scored by destroying armor by the use of anti-tank weapons, mines or grenades.

data.name: ribbon/23Desc
data.value: Using the Thompson M1A1 submachinegun in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/5Desc
data.value: Capturing control points is the key to winning battles.\nUse the map (M) to find the nearest control point and stand near the radio to capture it to earn points for this ribbon.

data.name: ribbon/6Desc
data.value: Being in the front of an assault will give you an advantage over your enemy.\nPoints for this ribbon are earned by not getting killed, capturing objectives and long range sniper kills.

data.name: ribbon/24Desc
data.value: Using the PPD-40 submachinegun in battle will earn you points on this ribbon.\nMore points are awarded for hitting or killing enemy soldiers. The highest award is given for headshots.

data.name: ribbon/7Desc

data.name: soldierrank/SoldierRankDescription
data.value: During combat the soldier earns experience that increases his rank. Higher ranks introduce new command opportunities as well as an increase in his salary. Officers and generals earn experience from commanding assault teams in the war.

data.name: soldierrank/SoldierSalaryIncreased
data.value: Your base salary has been increased to

data.name: soldierrank/SoldierSalaryDescription
data.value: The soldier receives a base salary for his time in battle, regardless of how he performs.\nThe base salary is an amount of credits per hour according to the soldier's rank.\nPerforming actions to the benefit of his side will earn him additional credits beyond the base salary, and an extra bonus is earned for victories.

data.name: StrategyGUI/AntiCheat/battleye_information_header
data.value: 1. HEROES & GENERALS USES BATTLEYE 2. BATTLEYE EULA

data.name: StrategyGUI/AntiCheat/battleye_accept_body
data.value:
1. HEROES & GENERALS USES BATTLEYE. You asked, we listened: New Anti-Cheat system, BattlEye, is now implemented to make Heroes & Generals fun and fair for everyone and provide an effective shield against cheats and hacks. Enjoy! Please click button below to get started.
AS A FURTHER CONDITION FOR USING HEROES & GENERALS®, YOU AGREE THAT WE MAY USE OUR OWN OR PARTNERS’ ANTI-CHEAT TECHNOLOGIES IN CONNECTION WITH ANY OF OUR GAME SERVICES AND IN PARTICULAR WITH HEROES & GENERALS® ("THE GAME SERVICE").
WHEN PLAYERS CONNECT TO GAME SERVERS, THESE TECHNOLOGIES WILL ACTIVATE AND MONITOR GAME PLAY, THE GAME FILES ASSOCIATED WITH THE GAME SERVICE AND RAM OF THE PLAYER'S COMPUTER. THESE TECHNOLOGIES DETECT CHEATING AND ANY UNAUTHORIZED THIRD-PARTY PROGRAMS RUNNING CONCURRENTLY WITH THE GAME SERVICE AND ANY MODIFICATIONS TO THE GAME SERVICE FILES ENABLING OR FACILITATING CHEATING. AN UNAUTHORIZED THIRD-PARTY PROGRAM IS ANY THIRD-PARTY PROGRAM OR FILE (SUCH AS AN “ADDON”, “MOD”, “HACK”, “TRAINER”, “AIMBOT”, “ESP” OR “CHEAT”) THAT WE BELIEVE ENABLES OR FACILITATES CHEATING OF ANY TYPE, ALLOWS USERS TO MODIFY OR HACK THE GAME SERVICE INTERFACE, ENVIRONMENT, OR EXPERIENCE IN ANY WAY NOT EXPRESSLY AUTHORIZED BY TLM Partners Inc., OR INTERCEPTS, “MINES”, OR OTHERWISE COLLECTS INFORMATION FROM OR THROUGH THE GAME SERVICE. WHEN PLAYERS DISCONNECT FROM THE GAME SERVICE, THESE ANTI-CHEAT TECHNOLOGIES WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY DEACTIVATED.
IF OUR ANTI-CHEAT TECHNOLOGIES SUSPECT CHEATING, WE MAY COLLECT RELEVANT INFORMATION, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO YOUR TLM AND/OR HEROES & GENERALS® ACCOUNT NAME, DETAILS ABOUT ANY UNAUTHORIZED THIRD-PARTY PROGRAMS, THE GAME SERVICE FILES MODIFICATION DETECTED, AND THE TIME AND DATE THE CHEATING WAS SUSPECTED TO OCCUR. IF WE DETERMINE A PLAYER HAS BEEN CHEATING, WE MAY ALSO, AT OUR DISCRETION, DECIDE TO TERMINATE THE TARGETED ACCOUNT, EITHER TEMPORARILY OR PERMANENTLY, DEPENDING ON THE OFFENSE BASED ON SUCH FACTORS AS RECURRENCES, SEVERITY OF THE CHEAT, AND IMPACT TO OTHER PLAYERS. IN ADDITION TO TERMINATION OF A PLAYER’S ACCOUNTS, LEGAL ACTION MAY BE TAKEN AGAINST PERSONS OR ENTITIES INFRINGING ON OUR RIGHTS.

data.name: StrategyGUI/AntiCheat/battleye_eula
data.value:
2. BATTLEYE EULA
****** End-User License Agreement ******
This License Agreement ("Agreement") is made between you (the "Licensee") and BattlEye Innovations e.K. (the "Licensor" and the "Data Processor") on behalf of TLM Partners Inc. (the "Data Controller"). The terms of this Agreement apply to all current and future versions and updates of BattlEye anti-cheat software ("BattlEye").
By installing, enabling or using BattlEye, Licensee agrees with all the terms of this Agreement. Licensor reserves all rights not specifically granted and transferred to Licensee.
Licensee understands, acknowledges and agrees with the following:
- Licensor grants Licensee a non-exclusive and non-transferable license to use BattlEye for non-commercial purposes only. Licensee therefore does not own BattlEye, Licensor remains the owner of BattlEye.
- Licensor provides BattlEye on an "as is" basis without warranty of any kind. Licensor neither guarantees the correct, error-free functioning of BattlEye nor is Licensor responsible for any damage caused by the use of BattlEye.
- Licensee may not decompile, disassemble, reverse-engineer, modify or redistribute BattlEye in any way.
- BattlEye will automatically, without notice to Licensee, download and install updates from time to time.
- BattlEye may scan Licensee's entire random access memory (RAM), and any game-related and system-related files and folders on Licensee's system using cheat-program-identifying algorithms, transmit results of such algorithms to other connected computers and/or to Licensor and process such information for the sole purpose of preventing and detecting the use of cheat programs. BattlEye only scans and/or processes data which is reasonably necessary to be scanned and/or processed to meet this purpose.
- BattlEye may collect and process Licensee's Internet Protocol address, game account name and identifier, in-game nickname, and system-related and hardware-related information including, but not limited to, device identifiers and hardware serial numbers.
- Licensor processes all information collected by BattlEye on servers located in the European Union. Licensor may share the information with its partners and/or affiliates.
- Licensee acknowledges that the invasive nature of BattlEye is necessary to meet its purpose and goal of preventing and detecting cheat programs.
- Licensor is allowed to terminate the license at any time for any reason and without notice to Licensee.
This License Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Licensor and Licensee and supersedes any prior statements.

data.name: StrategyGUI/General/unsupported_client_discord_desc
data.value:
Soldiers,

Due to Discord ceasing operations of the Discord Store, we are no longer able to support the Discord version of HnG. Effective March 1, 2022, this version will no longer be available.

Please note that the Discord server is not going anywhere and will continue to serve as our main channel of communication with the community. Make no mistake: Our mission is to leave no soldier behind. Your HnG account will ensure that the transition to the Steam and Epic Games Store versions of HnG will be a seamless and uninterrupted experience. All gear, items, currency and soldiers will be carried over when you make the switch.

Nevertheless, we appreciate your patience during this change.

data.name: StrategyGUI/General/unsupported_client_discord_title
data.value: Migrating to Steam Store and Epic Games Store

data.name: StrategyGUI/General/unsupported_client_desc
data.value: We have decided to move away from the clients used for My.Games and the Standalone version. This difficult decision was reached to focus more of our efforts on the game itself. Effective March 15, 2022, these versions will no longer be available.\n\nMake no mistake: our mission is to leave no soldier behind. Your HnG account will ensure that the transition to the Steam and Epic Games Store versions of HnG will be a seamless and uninterrupted experience. All gear, items, currency and soldiers will be carried over when you make the switch.

data.name: StrategyGUI/General/unsupported_client_title
data.value: Migrating to Steam Store and Epic Games Store

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/unlock_squad_customization
data.value:
When your soldier is promoted to squad leader you will be able to apply the following upgrades to his squad:
- Naming the squad to make it unique.
- Adding more squad member seats.
- Issue orders to squad members in battle.
- Decide at what location the squad deploys in battle.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/game_mode_war_1

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_capture_hold_tanks_desc

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/game_mode_skirmish_1

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_assault_small_desc

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_assault_desc
data.value: All soldier classes fight for control of a strategically important battlefield by capturing or defending control points along multiple lines leading to the objective(s).\nThe enemy is controlled by players.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_war_desc
data.value: War battles are initiated by Commanders (Officers and Generals) moving troops on the war map.\nBe prepared to face highly skilled enemy soldiers of any army branch on any battlefield.\nThe enemy and army resources are controlled by players.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/war_battle_queue
data.value: Your squad is in queue for:

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_capture_hold_recons_desc
data.value: As Recon, your orders are to destroy the enemy reconnaissance forces and help our infantry capture the objective.\nEnemy reconnaissance forces are controlled by players, infantry is controlled by AI.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_capture_hold_pilots_desc
data.value: As Pilots, your orders are to destroy the enemy air force and help our infantry capture the objective.\nEnemy planes are controlled by players, infantry is controlled by AI.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_unavailable_war_faction_mismatch
data.value: The selected soldier does not match your selected war faction.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_unavailable_squad_faction_mismatch
data.value: All squad members need to belong to the same war faction.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_unavailable_faction_not_selected
data.value: In order to participate in the war, you must be part of a faction. Click the WAR tab to select a faction.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_unavailable_invalid_vehicle_filters
data.value: You need to select at least one vehicle class in the vehicle filter.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/war_requirements_squad_faction_and_member_faction
data.value: The squad and soldiers belong to the same faction

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_capture_hold_specialist_desc
data.value: As either a tank crewman, pilot or recon you need to keep the enemy at bay while our infantry captures the objectives.\nEnemy specialists are controlled by players, while infantry are controlled by AI.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_quick_battle_selected_faction_desc
data.value: This Quick Battle mode offers quick matchmaking and sends you into battle with any soldier from your currently selected faction.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_quick_battle_selected_soldier_desc
data.value: This Quick Battle mode offers quick matchmaking and sends you into any kind of battle suited for your currently selected soldier.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_quick_battle_benefits_2_tooltip
data.value: Earn +25% Rank XP and Ribbon XP in this game mode.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/gamemode_quick_battle_benefits_1_tooltip

data.name: StrategyGUI/Squad/matchmaking/info_advanced_filters_wait

data.name: StrategyGUI/SubscriptionInfo/General/benefits_explanation
data.value:
- <highlight>Level up your soldiers twice as fast</highlight> by earning twice as much Rank XP per battle.
 - <highlight>Unlock new weapons, vehicles and equipment earlier</highlight> by earning more Ribbon XP per battle.
 - <highlight>Afford new weapons, vehicles and equipment earlier</highlight> by earning more credits per battle.
 - <highlight>Allow your soldiers to carry more weapons or equipment</highlight> by unlocking an extra Equipment Slot.
 - <highlight>Give your soldiers more battle perks</highlight> by unlocking a second Combat Badge Slot.
 - <highlight>Earn even more XP by playing in a squad</highlight> (your Squad XP bonus even stacks with other veterans in your squad).
 - <highlight>Afford more assault teams, men and vehicles</highlight> for your officers and generals by earning more Warfunds per battle.

data.name: StrategyGUI/SubscriptionInfo/General/benefits_explanation_headline
data.value: Veteran Membership lets you and your soldier roster level up faster and gives you a number of perks.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser1
data.value: FIND A BATTLE \nThe server can help you find a battle that matches your experience and soldier. For this first game, we'll make sure you're matched with other new players.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser12
data.value: STAGED BATTLE \nStaged battles are balanced to be more accessible for new players. When you gain more experience, the advanced and more challenging battles in the war become available.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser0
data.value: ENTER A BATTLE \nThe easiest way to learn about the game is through experience! Click this button to join a battle.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/auto_equip_weapon
data.value: Your new submachinegun will be equipped in Equipment slot #1

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser5
data.value: VIEW UNLOCKED AND LOCKED EQUIPMENT \nClick here to see the weapons and equipment available for purchase. Later, you can return here to see what you'll be able to unlock with more experience.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser13
data.value: SWITCH SOLDIERS \nYou have additional soldiers, for other factions. Click here to switch between them.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser9
data.value: EQUIP YOUR NEW WEAPON \nClick here to view your equipment, including your new weapon.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser4
data.value: BUY A WEAPON \nWith the credits you just made in battle, you can buy an entry-level submachinegun. This will enable you to try out another style of fighting in your next battle.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser6
data.value: BROWSE WEAPONS \nThe list shows all the weapons that your soldier may unlock and buy. Most of them require more combat experience, but this submachinegun is available. Select the unlocked submachinegun from the list of equipment.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser7
data.value: BUY THE WEAPON \nYou can now see some detailed information about the weapon. Click here to spend some of the coins you earned on the new weapon.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstBattleOverSmgUnlock
data.value: You've unlocked a submachinegun, \nthe %g, \nand earned enough credits to buy it.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser11
data.value: EQUIP THE SUBMACHINEGUN \nNow you have freed up some equipment points, and can check the box next to the submachinegun to equip it.

data.name: StrategyGUI/Tutorial/FirstTimeUser10
data.value: MAKE ROOM FOR THE SUBMACHINEGUN \nTo have enough equipment points available for your new submachinegun, you need to unequip your old weapon by unchecking it here.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/novice_flavour
data.value:
War is raging over Europe, and we need every able-bodied soldier to win it. At the start of your career, you will be participating in encounters, skirmishes and assaults that don’t directly impact the war.
Once you’ve proven your worth and reached level 10, you will be able to participate in the war proper. When you join the war you will not only affect the outcome of the war as a soldier, but also be able to command your own assault teams and make strategic decisions that impact where and how the war is fought for thousands of other players.
In addition, you will %x in every battle and gain the ability to %w

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/calltoaction_flavour
data.value:
You've fought hard and climbed the ranks. You’re now ready to participate in the war. As a proper participant, you will affect the outcome of the war as a soldier, but also be able to use your officer’s rank to command your own assault teams in the strategy game.
Command more teams as you progress and make strategic decisions on the war map which affect where and how thousands of other players fight.
In addition, you will %x in every battle and gain the ability to %w
Click the button or visit the War tab to enter the next stage in your career.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/army_strength_flavour
data.value: Numbers are an estimate based on the amount of deployed command points.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/current_war_new
data.value: A new war has begun. %s is now being fought.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/war_ended_won_by
data.value: War has ended. %w was won by %f

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/elite_flavour
data.value: Here's what happened while you were away:

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/winning_player_faction_cities
data.value: %f is winning. You need to capture just %c more major cities to win.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/winning_opponent_faction_cities
data.value: %f is winning. They need to capture just %c more major cities to win.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/territories_flavour
data.value: To win the war, your faction must capture and hold %c of the %m major cities.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/wins_losses_flavour
data.value: Since your last login, %a forces won %w battles and suffered %l losses.

data.name: StrategyGUI/WarUpdate/earn_xp
data.value: earn 50% more ribbon and rank XP

data.name: Tutorial/10_2Desc
data.value: Then choose to resupply using either credits or gold.\n To automatically resupply after every battle, tick the appropriate checkbox.

data.name: Tutorial/11_1Desc
data.value: Heroes & Generals offers several game modes which unlock as your Player Level increases by scoring points in the game.\n While certain game modes can take longer to queue up for, Quick Battles gets you to the action faster by allowing the matchmaker to find a suitable battle using any soldier in your roster.\n To start a Quick Battle, click the <highlight>TO BATTLE</highlight> button and select a Quick Battle option from the game mode menu.

data.name: Tutorial/9_1Desc
data.value: All weapons accrue wear and tear when used in battle.\n As a weapon wears out, the background bar fills up and becomes increasingly more red. Once a weapon breaks, you will not be able to use it in battle until it has been fully repaired.\n To repair a weapon, click the maintenance icon.

data.name: Tutorial/6_1Desc
data.value: Once your soldier is fully equipped, you're ready to send him into battle.\n Click the <highlight>TO BATTLE</highlight> button.

data.name: Tutorial/7_2Desc
data.value: To recruit a new soldier, click the <highlight>+ button</highlight> in your soldier roster.\n Alternatively, you can click the Store and select the Soldiers category.

data.name: Tutorial/4_3Desc
data.value: The total carrying capacity of your soldier is limited by the size and weight of weapons, which are expressed as small white dots called <highlight>Equipment Points</highlight>.\n The more equipment points are used up, the faster your soldier will lose stamina in battle. Your loadout cannot exceed your soldier's total amount of equipment points.

data.name: Tutorial/6_2Desc
data.value: Then pick a game mode to join a battle.\n By scoring points in the game, more game modes unlock as your Player Level increases.

data.name: Tutorial/7_1Desc
data.value:
Heroes & Generals is a multi-character game and offers several advantages to having multiple soldiers in your roster.
 No matter which faction you selected initially, you will be able to own - and play as - soldiers from any faction.
 As new classes become available, not only will you be able to recruit and play as tank crewmen, pilots, recons or paratroopers, but also switch between them during battle.
 Having the ability to switch between soldiers with different loadouts mid-battle gives you a substantial leg up and allows you to quickly adapt to any situation.

data.name: Tutorial/10_1Desc
data.value: As you spend ammunition in battle, you will eventually need to resupply.\n To resupply a weapon with ammo, click the maintenance icon.

data.name: Tutorial/8_2Desc
data.value: Select the soldier you wish to deploy from the list.\n If the resources are available in battle, you can even switch to a different soldier class. Note that changing to a different class than the one you entered into battle with will incur a higher <highlight>maintenance load</highlight>.\n The maintenance load determines how fast you can deploy a new soldier after one gets killed. If your soldiers get killed too quickly, the maintenance crew becomes overloaded and you may need to wait before you can deploy again. For every soldier, the maintenance load is depicted as a circular bar.

data.name: Tutorial/3_1Desc
data.value: At the heart of Heroes & Generals is the <highlight>War mode</highlight> which pits all factions against each other in a massive, persistent war for Europe.\n Every battle fought in this mode is visible on the war map and you can follow the tides of war in real time. Glowing points on the map are battles that can be fought by you and other players. Click a location to see more info.\n Winning the war requires one faction to capture 15 of the 23 major cities.

data.name: Tutorial/9_2Desc
data.value: Then choose to repair using either credits or gold.\n If you prefer to have your weapon automatically repaired after every battle, click the appropriate checkbox.

data.name: Tutorial/4_2Desc
data.value: To equip a weapon, click and drag it from your soldier's inventory into his loadout. To remove it, drag it back.\n Note that only weapons unlocked and owned by your soldier will be available for use. New weapons and equipment will unlock as your soldier progresses.

data.name: Tutorial/19_2Desc
data.value: Then choose to repair using either credits or gold.\n If you prefer to have your vehicle automatically repaired after every battle, click the appropriate checkbox.

data.name: Tutorial/1_1Desc
data.value: Soldiers are always deploying on the battlefield along an attack line. The attack line leads to the objective and as your team captures control points along the line, you will be able to deploy closer and closer to the objective.\n To deploy your soldier, click an available control point on the battlefield overview map and then select a deploy zone.

data.name: Tutorial/5_1Desc
data.value: Every action your soldier performs in battle earns him Combat Ribbon Experience, which in turn unlocks new weapons, gear and vehicles. Once unlocked, the equipment can be purchased for your soldier using the credits he earns in battle.\n To purchase an unlocked weapon for your soldier, click the silver- or gold-colored price buttons to purchase it using either credits or gold.

data.name: Tutorial/3_3Desc
data.value: War mode will become available when you reach Player Level 10. The battles you fight in other game modes take place outside of major battlefields and will not be visible on the war map.\n The outcomes of those battles do contribute to the war in an indirect way though, as salvageable resources left on the battlefield by retreating enemies get added to your faction's resource stockpile.

data.name: Tutorial/8_1Desc
data.value: A big advantage to having multiple soldiers in your roster is that you can switch between them in battle to quickly adapt to changing conditions.\n Tanks causing you trouble? Having a second infantryman with anti-tank weaponry in your roster might be just the ticket to even out the odds.\n In order to switch to another soldier, click the Soldier Switch button.

data.name: Tutorial/2_1Desc
data.value: You now have access to <highlight>Career Orders</highlight>. Early career orders are designed to help teach you the ins and outs of Heroes & Generals as well as providing you with rewards for each completed order.\n Your orders are accessible from the top right corner of the Soldiers screen. Click them to open the full list of orders.

data.name: Tutorial/27_2Desc
data.value: Browse through upgrade categories by clicking the tabs above the list.\n To apply an upgrade, select one from the list and tick the checkbox next to it to activate it.\n Note that the list shows all upgrades - even ones your soldier has not unlocked yet. An upgrade needs to be unlocked and owned by your soldier in order to be applied.

data.name: Tutorial/4_1Desc
data.value: In order to prepare your soldier for battle, you will need to gear him up.\n On the Soldier screen you will find your soldier's current loadout to the left and his inventory to the right.\n Your soldier has 3 loadout slots (4 with Veteran Membership) for weapons and equipment.

data.name: Tutorial/3_2Desc
data.value: In the War mode, the resources (soldiers and vehicles) available in every battle are supplied by generals controlled by other players. Generals deploy those resources in the form of <highlight>Assault Teams</highlight> via the war map. Assault Teams can take many forms, such as Guard teams, Heavy Armor teams or Fighter Squadrons.\n Clicking a battlefield occupied by your faction will show you information about the assault teams located there.

data.name: Tutorial/28_1Desc
data.value: Upgrades can be used to improve your vehicle. Increase the damage output or armor penetration of armed vehicles with different kinds ammunition. Equip mounted machine guns, medic crates or weapon crates to help resupply your fellow troops. Change the paint job to better blend in or strike fear into the hearts of your enemies.\n To manage upgrades for a vehicle, click on the icon as shown.

data.name: Tutorial/16_2Desc
data.value: To see redeemed and upcoming rewards, click <highlight>Daily Rewards</highlight> on the Bulletin screen.

data.name: Tutorial/20_1Desc
data.value: As you spend ammunition in battle, you will eventually need to resupply.\n To resupply a vehicle's ammo, click the maintenance icon and choose to resupply using either credits or gold.\n If you prefer to have your vehicle automatically resupplied after every battle, click the appropriate checkbox.

data.name: Tutorial/13_3Desc
data.value: The Specialization screen tracks your progress for a certain playstyle with tables of unlockable gear tuned for each specialization.\n To return to the Progression overview, click the arrow button.

data.name: Tutorial/28_2Desc
data.value: Browse through upgrade categories by clicking the tabs above the list.\n To apply an upgrade, select one from the list and tick the checkbox next to it to activate it.\n Note that the list shows all upgrades - even ones your soldier has not unlocked yet. An upgrade needs to be unlocked and owned by your soldier in order to be applied.

data.name: Tutorial/15_2Desc
data.value: Then select <highlight>Join Channel</highlight> and click a channel.\n Channels with a padlock icon are open by invitation only.

data.name: Tutorial/16_1Desc
data.value: Did you know that Heroes & Generals offers you a reward for the first completed battle of each day?\n There are even special bonus rewards which grow bigger for each consecutive day played!\n To redeem your reward, complete your first battle for the day and hit the <highlight>Redeem button</highlight> after the battle ends.

data.name: Tutorial/19_1Desc
data.value: Like weapons, vehicles accrue wear and tear when used in battle.\n As a vehicle wears out, the background bar fills up and becomes increasingly more red. Once a vehicle breaks, you will not be able to use it in battle until it has been fully repaired.\n To repair a vehicle, click the maintenance icon.

data.name: Tutorial/13_2Desc
data.value: Increase your Player Level by racking up a score capturing control points, performing kills, destroying vehicles and winning battles. Each Player Level unlocks new soldier classes, game modes and abilities, eventually gaining you access to the War mode.\n From the Progression overview you can keep track of upcoming Player Level unlocks by scrolling along the horizontal axis.\n Each soldier class also comes with a host of specializations and each one can be clicked to open the Specialization overview.

data.name: Tutorial/15_1Desc
data.value: Use the in-game chat to communicate with other players and squad mates or strategize with others from your faction.\n To join a channel, click the chat icon to expand it.

data.name: Tutorial/27_1Desc
data.value: Upgrades can be used to improve various aspects of firearms, such as recoil, precision, range, aim and damage output.\n To manage your upgrades for a weapon, click on the icon as shown.

data.name: Tutorial/18_3Desc
data.value: When your vehicle gets destroyed, the load gauge shows the work load of the maintenance crew as they start to prepare a new vehicle. If your vehicle repeatedly gets destroyed too quickly, the maintenance crew will get overloaded and can't prepare a new vehicle in time. You will then either have to wait or select a vehicle that has a smaller load.

data.name: Tutorial/12_2Desc
data.value: This is where you send and receive messages from your friends receive announcements and notifications.

data.name: Tutorial/13_1Desc
data.value: Heroes & Generals has three progression systems: Soldier Rank, Combat Ribbons and Player Level.\n To view all your progression in a single place, click the Progression tab.

data.name: Tutorial/14_1Desc
data.value: Combat Ribbons track a soldier's experience with certain skills. Your soldier earns XP on a ribbon by performing actions associated with it, like healing fellow soldiers, destroying tanks or using close combat weapons. Specialist Ribbons are even more focused and track your experience with specific types of weapons, vehicles or explosives.\n Leveling up a ribbon unlocks new weapons, vehicles, upgrades and equipment.\n To see all available ribbons in the game, click this button.

data.name: Tutorial/12_1Desc
data.value: Make sure you check your in-game mail. A notification icon will alert you whenever you have unread messages.\n To check your in-game mail, click the mail icon.

data.name: Tutorial/18_2Desc
data.value:
Pay attention to the health of your vehicle as well as the health of individual internal components.
 Your vehicle’s armor (shown as four quarter circles) deflects some of the damage, but will protect less and less as it wears down.
 Component damage will affect the handling and capabilities of your vehicle, but will not destroy it. Direct hits to ammunition compartments or the gas tank will generate a lot of damage, however.
 Once the total vehicle health nears zero, it's advisable to get out as it's likely to explode and kill you in the process.

data.name: Tutorial/24_3Desc
data.value: From the Squad Management dialog, click one of the available slots to invite a friend into the squad.\n Customize the squad name to your liking or leave it as is. Once your squad is populated, close the dialog.\n As the Squad Leader, you decide the game mode. Click <highlight>TO BATTLE</highlight> as usual to select one.

data.name: Tutorial/18_1Desc
data.value: In order to deploy with a vehicle, just select it from the deploy menu. Then click a deploy point on the map to enter the battle or select a vehicle-icon (when available) to deploy as passenger.\n Should you have the need to deploy on foot, simply select the boots.

data.name: Tutorial/14_2Desc
data.value: The Ribbon Overview shows you your soldier's progress on every ribbon.\n To see more detailed progress as well as item unlocks associated with a ribbon, simply select a ribbon and click the <highlight>View Progression</highlight> button.

data.name: Tutorial/24_2Desc
data.value: Squads are class-based, so all members of a Squad will need to join the squad with a soldier of the same class.\n The maximum size of a squad is also determined by the class and ranges from 2 to 4 players. To create a squad, make sure you select a soldier with the class you want to create a Squad for. I.e. to create an infantry squad, select an infantryman. Then click the Squad icon.

data.name: Tutorial/14_3Desc
data.value: The Ribbon Progression shows you detailed progress and what items are unlocked at which ribbon levels. If you have credits or gold to spare and want to progress faster, you can purchase a Booster which increases the Ribbon XP you earn in the game. If you simply can't wait to unlock a certain item, you can also complete a level outright by purchasing it.

data.name: Tutorial/17_2Desc
data.value: Each vehicle takes a certain amount of time to prepare between deployments in battle. We call this "maintenance load". In general, higher tier vehicles incur a bigger maintenance load than lower tier ones. The maintenance load is for each vehicle is shown as a circular bar.

data.name: Tutorial/24_1Desc
data.value: Every battle is joined as a Squad.\n Squads not only let you join battles with a team of friends - they also provide XP bonuses for everyone. The bigger the squad, the higher the XP bonus.\n In addition, the Squad Leader is able to issue commands to his squad mates and switch attack lines during battle if new ones become available.

data.name: Tutorial/17_1Desc
data.value: Your soldier has 3 loadout slots (4 with Veteran Membership) for vehicles.\n To equip a vehicle, make sure the vehicle tab is selected in your soldier's loadout. Then click and drag a vehicle from the inventory into a slot in the loadout. To remove it, drag it back.\n Note that only vehicles unlocked and owned by your soldier will be available for use. New vehicles and equipment will unlock as your soldier progresses.

data.name: Tutorial/23_2Desc
data.value: From here you can click the ""Find friend"" button

data.name: Tutorial/23_1Desc
data.value: Everything gets better with friends.\n To get started, open your Friends list by clicking the friends icon.

data.name: Tutorial/1_2Desc
data.value: Nearby friendly vehicles may offer a quicker way to the front lines, so if you see a moving mobile deploy point on the oveview map, click it to deploy as passenger.\n Infantry Support Vehicles are of particular strategic value because they act as mobile deploy points. Parking such a vehicle near an enemy control point will give your team the ability to deploy right in the enemy's backyard.

data.name: Tutorial/21_1Desc
data.value: In order to play War battles you must pick a side. For all War battles, you will be committed to the faction you pick for the duration of the war. You will still be able to play other game modes as any faction you want. To join a War faction, either click <highlight>TO BATTLE</highlight> and select <highlight>WAR!</highlight> from the game mode menu or click the War map.

data.name: Tutorial/21_2Desc
data.value: Select the faction you want to fight for in War battles for the duration of the war. Note that certain faction choices may come with a bonus or negative effects depending on the outcome of the previous war and the current faction population balance. Joining the most popular War faction may cause increased matchmaking times when playing War battles.

data.name: Tutorial/22_1Desc
data.value: If your faction is attacking from more than one attack line, you may be able to relocate your squad to a different line. In order to do this, your soldier must be a Squad Leader and be a high enough rank to have unlocked the ability to switch lines. The line you wish to switch to also needs to hold suitable resources for your squad type. I.e. if you are in a Tank Crew squad, the line needs to have tank crewmen and tanks present (hover you mouse cursor over the access point to see available resources). If the conditions are met, click an Access Point for the line you wish to relocate to.

data.name: Tutorial/22_2Desc
data.value: Then click a deploy zone to confirm the relocation of your squad.

data.name: Tutorial/25_1Desc
data.value:
Anti-tank weapons come in many flavors, each with their own pros and cons.
 Sticky grenades require you to get up close and personal, but makes it easy to target specific internal components of a tank.
 Anti-tank mines are safer require a greater deal of luck, but are great for protecting high traffic areas, inroads or bridges.
 Rocket launchers provide a decent compromise of safe distance and precision.
 Each tank is different, however, so do your research and figure out where internal components are located and where the armor is weakest.

data.name: Tutorial/26_3Title
data.value: Capture & Hold Battles - How to Play

data.name: Tutorial/26_3Desc
data.value: The victory points are shown in a bar for each faction at the top of the screen. The first faction to fill the bar wins.\n The more objective points a faction holds, the faster the bar will fill.\n The icons underneath the bar indicate which objective point is being held by which faction at any given time.

data.name: Tutorial/26_2Desc
data.value: Taking an objective point requires you to be within the capture zone until the capture progress completes. If the control point is contested by enemy soldiers, the faction with the most soldiers in the capture zone will capture it.

data.name: Tutorial/26_2Title
data.value: Capture & Hold Battles - How to Play

data.name: Tutorial/26_1Title
data.value: Capture & Hold Battles - How to Play

data.name: Tutorial/26_1Desc
data.value:
Capture & Hold game mode pits two factions against each other to capture one or more objective points at the center of the map.
 Each faction starts at opposite access points and may attack the objective points in any order.
 The faction that holds the most objective points will gain victory points.
 Each team's access point (starting point) on the map is determined by which supply route their assault teams arrived from.

data.name: Tutorial/2_2Desc
data.value: From the overview you can browse all Career Orders and track your progress on each one.\n As you progress in the game, orders will eventually get tougher and rewards will get bigger.\n Many career orders also come with tutorials to help you out. Click the tutorial-buttons to get help.

data.name: uniformvarianttemplate/uniformvarianttype/0Desc
data.value: Sometimes the guy at the equipment depot gets his hands on a uniform or a piece of headgear from another branch, a different color, or even some experimental camouflage that was never meant to appear on the battlefield.

data.name: unlockItemType/12UnlockMessage
data.value: Squad Upgrade Points give you and your squad members an additional XP bonus.

data.name: unlockItemType/11UnlockMessage
data.value: You have earned one command point. Use it to command assault teams in the war (rank 12+ only).
